lead_paragraph: The former Southern California star O. J. Mayo has been dropped by his agent because of the ”overwhelming intensity” of allegations that Mayo illegally received cash and gifts. Mayo had announced that Calvin Andrews of Bill Duffy Associates would represent him. But the sports management group issued a statement Thursday saying their association was over. BDA Sports said it would ask the N.B.A. Players Association to waive the standard 15-day cooling-off period so Mayo could sign with a new agent immediately.
